summary: Messy and mischievous Marmaduke has a big heart but can't stay out of trouble! Does he have what it takes to shine in the swanky dog show world?

reviews.content: atrocious, heinous, barbarous, these are all words used by the same person (me) to describe this movie, not only is Pete Davidson in it, there's bad scripting, bad voice acting and overall bad animation, its like most of Pete's lines were just off the dome, and lets not forget abt marmaduke, he was so weird, the fact that he was as big as a kangaroo was scary, and how much dept he caused his family. I think only a visually impared, deaf person could like this movie. there was just SO much wrong with it. and there were also some continuity errors, like in one of the very first scenes when marmaduke caused a tsunami, the dad said "diggity dang that dog" HE DIDNT EVEN SEE THE DOG. and if i had to cover the character designs, this would be an entire essay. but all i have to say is that this is a TERRIBLE MOVIE, do NOT recommend
Best movie ever! Terrible animation, bad outdated jokes, so good! 5 stars!

Makes so called "mAsTeRiEcEs" like The Sawshank Redemption and Forrest Gump look like trash like the mediocre mess that is things like The Godfather and Breaking Bad. Marmaduke was a spectacular piece of cinematography, some may say a work of art. The plot of a dog who was doubted his whole life due to his lackluster looks wins over the hearts of all those who visit the dog show, his rival: a snarky poodle is trying to sabotage his success. At the end of the day he comes out victorious. The sheer amount of jokes in this movie is quite appealing, it enticed me to the point where I watched this cinematic masterpiece nearly 40 times! Everyone should watch this movie, kids, parents, elders, & anyone alike. All attempts at hilarious comments landed perfectly. All in all this movie is five stars.

There are some movies that are so bad, they're good. This is not one of those movies. The fact that Pete Davidson (whose work I generally enjoy) and JK Simmons (whose work I generally love) star in this film is absurd. I wonder if either of them had read the script before showing up to record.

The animation is subpar (the body proportions are creepily . . . off), the voice acting is rough (sounds like reading the script), and the mouths regularly don't match with the voices. I honestly hope to never watch this movie again.

I usually go with the best, but I have to do the worst for this film:

Worst Character: Phil
Worst Scene: The Talent Show
Worst Quote: "Bacon. . . b b b . . . bacon"
Worst Song: "The Marmaduke Rap"

Note: "Marmaduke" is best described using the facepalm emoji.

It seems like a comedy written by someone trying to think of what other people would think is funny. The story is bland, but at least it follows a point a to point b approach, and the ending is confusing. The animation is also not very good but based on how long it took to make this movie, the animators weren't given enough time to make things work well. It was a bad idea that was executed poorly and should have been given much more time to come to fruition. There's a reason most animated movies take four years, not one.

This movie changed my life. Before this movie, I had severe depression and was on the verge of ending it all. Then, I decided to watch one more movie, and landed on the 2022 classic of Marmaduke. I watched it and instantly I was hooked. It brought me back to my childhood, all the happy memories flooding my brain. I laughed, I cried, I laughed again, and I cried again, it was the most beautiful moment of my life. When the movie ended I sobbed of joy, knowing now I had a reason to keep going, I had Marmaduke. Thank you Marmaduke, I owe you my life.

Best movie I have ever seen. It's impressive how god tier every element of it is. I cried throughout the whole movie, the voice acting is incredible, the soundtrack is perfect, the symbolism and worldbuilding are expert... This truly is the Dark Souls of Japanese Shoot em Ups.

This movie was life changing and I think if you don't see it you will be left in the shadows, before I watch this movie I could lift 10kg, I'm now benching 3,000kg. This was no exception.  I'm afraid they don't have long to survive without being acquired.

Worst film I have ever watched!

Oh, my, where do I even begin with this film?
-In the first few minutes of the film, we see Marmaduke being barricaded in his room, where the owners selfishly lock up their dog in a room, and for what? Misbehaving?
-Watching Guy kick Marmaduke in his, let's say... groin... shows that the producers and the studio who have produced this film are promoting and normalising animal cruelty. I mean, what am I even watching?!
-The training scene? The concept behind it was the only good moment in the film because it referenced Nintendogs, but the production company executed it poorly as it was just filler!
-How is watching Marmaduke getting injured funny? It isn't.
-$100 is way too expensive for dog shampoo, the most expensive for that product is around $60-70.
-Plot Hole: How does Marmaduke even know who Zeus is?!
-Zeus isn't even a good villain! What type of villain even lures somebody into eating a lot of food?
-Marmaduke's burping and farting are created using green smoke clouds. Speaking of, that isn't even good.
   It is also worth noting that Marmaduke's farting had potentially killed a lot of wildlife for how big it was. Realistically, a big fart would kill everyone in the entire planet's population, as seen in "SML Movie: Jeffy's Coma".
-The animation drops in frame rate in most scenes, and the characters' arms and legs are pretty thin, not matching the character's proportions. Even their necks and legs make the human characters look taller than they usually should in real life. The animation even looks like a cheap, bland video game released for a Nintendo 64, Dreamcast, Nintendo GameCube, PlayStation 2, PlayStation or XBOX console.

Overall, this film is just nothing but nonsense; I recommend watching another film with a simple story. I could have rated it 0/5 stars, but Rotten Tomatoes' possible rating is 0.5 out of five.
-Nakiebra "Keebie" Palmer

This is the absolute worst film to ever be made. 

Warning (!) Spoilers:
First being BEYOND over,  the animation was terrible, and there was no meaning to this film

First, the film being beyond over, what I mean by that is when (SPOILERS) marmaduke first jumped into the pool and suddenly the whole neighborhood or universe got covered in water. Seriously? That was so unnecessary, way too over, and not funny at all same goes to the part where marmaduke randomly went and pooped on the trophy, the amount of farts that was spread was beyond over.

Second, the animation being really terrible, where are we? In the 2000? The animation is just like these terrible animations you would watch YouTubers ranting about. There's not much to say about the animation right now but all I could say is that ONLY IF YOU PUT WAY MORE EFFORT ON THE ANIMATION THEN THE FILM MAY HAVE BEEN A LITTLE BETTER.

And last which I consider the LEAST is that there was no meaning to this film, are you kidding me right now? My mother likes to watch movies at cinemas that provide great meaning to it, but instead my mom wasted her money for this trash. (SPOILERS!!) after guy quit training  marmaduke, then after while when marmaduke came, all who watched the movie know when guy refused to train marmaduke for the embarrassment he has done, marmaduke SERIOUSLY TRAVELS SOLO WITH HIS BARE LEGS AND HANDS TO MANY COUNTRIES IN A DAY THEN STARTS TRENDING ON THE MEDIA?! ARE YOU JOKING ME? MARMADUKE IS A DOG WHY WOULD REPORTERS REPORT THIS ON THE MEDIA AND MAKE THIS GO VIRAL?! And when marmaduke came back after "PROVING" he isn't just any dog without skills, out of NO WHERE A WHOLE CROWD APPEARS BEHIND HIM ENCOURAGING MARMADUKE?! And the part I hate the MOST when the kid calls guy a FAILURE and was about to walk away, guy eventually feels MOTIVATED? BY BEING CALLED A FAILURE WOW EVENTUALLY THE KID SAVED EVERYONE'S LIVES BY CALLING GUY A FAILURE AND GETTING HIM BACK TO TRAINING MARMADUKE JUST BECAUSE NO ONE HAS EVER CALLED HIM A FAILURE.
